title: `Unimplemented` selecting `Binder(<std::pin::Pin<std::boxed::Box<B>> as std::ops::Drop>, [])`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
use std::pin::Pin;

fn main() {
    let a = Enum::A(Pin::new(Box::new(A())));
    let b = Enum::B(Pin::new(Box::new(B())));
    println!("{:?} {:?}", a, b);
}

#[derive(Debug)]
enum Enum {
    A(Pin<Box<A>>),
    B(Pin<Box<B>>),
}

#[derive(Debug)]
struct A();

impl Drop for Pin<Box<A>> {
    fn drop(&mut self) {}
}

#[derive(Debug)]
struct B();

// UNCOMMENT TO FIX COMPILER ERROR
// impl Drop for Pin<Box<B>> {
//     fn drop(&mut self) {}
// }

```


### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c
commit-date: 2022-04-04
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.60.0
LLVM version: 14.0.0
```
